TopicTitle: Loading Screen Stuck With "#autoLOC_(8 numbers here)" Above Loading Bar

Articles.Content:
KSP: 1.4.5 Windows 64bit

Problem: Loading screen never progresses after getting stuck on "KAX/Parts/KAX_turboProp/KAX_turboProp/KAXturboprop" and has "#autoLOC_(8 numbers here)" above the bar.

Mods Installed:

BDArmoryContinued

Firespitter

KAX

MagicSmokeIndustries

OPT

Physics Range Extender

SM_AFVs

VesselMover

ModuleManger

Reproduction Steps: Honestly can't really tell, it just happens after every fresh install.

Log: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-4fk84_CzgweKvLxHbzZkJwOu8PJjLGl/view?usp=sharing

You can see the NullReferenceExceptions being thrown after attempting to load several of these KAX parts. Not sure what's causing this, but I would recommend asking in the KAX thread, providing this log and maybe a link to this thread. They should be able to help you with the specifics. 
I would recommend loading the game again after removing these parts, to see if these are really the problem (the parts being the KAX electricprop, kueyEngine, kueyTailRotor, and turboprop). If this doesn't fix it, I'm not sure what's going on, and you should definitly ask in the KAX thread. If it does fix it, I would recommend letting the KAX person/people know, so they can get a fix out. 

Hope this helps. 

Edited September 6, 2018 by Benjamin Kerman

Just now, KidWithTheHands said:

no. i don't. Is there a way to fix it?

Sure You bought the game on steam so the easiest solution would be to check your file integrity. Right click the game in your game library -> properties -> local files -> check for issues (I don't know the correct english name for this button, but there are just 5, you will find the correct one ). Steam should find the missing files and will download them again.

In the folder must be a single file called 'dictionary.cfg'

Ok, let me show you something strange. I've setup a fresh install of 1.4.5 without DLC and compared my log with yours. On the left side is your log, on the right side is mine:

Spoiler

The big grey parts in your log are missing entries and my log already got 4k lines more than yours when my game finished loading all the configs.  To be more precise: except for the localization.cfg, your whole install misses all the stock configs for agencies, contracts, resources, parts and so on. As soon as KSP tries to load the part database, your game is stuck since the game cannot find any parts (because their configs are missing).

Please check your KSP install folder, if these config files are indeed missing, for example:
D:\Games 2018\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program\GameData\Squad\Parts\Aero\airbreak\Airbreak.cfg

If the config file isn't there, there must be a program in the background messing up your install. You already said that you don't use the twitch/curse launcher so the best guess I have, is a anti virus program going riot on KSP.

But if the config file does exist and KSP just don't load it, I have aboslute no clue what's the reason for the issue.

(On a sidenote: You run the 32bit version again but that's not the problem here)

Backing up what cheese has said, in the past this issue has been caused by a messed up stock install.   Which was caused by some third party software mucking around where it shouldn't.

Clean out everything KSP related.   Everything.   Even other software that might affect it.  

Download a new clean install of KSP, don't use a cached or previously downloaded version. 

Install it. 

Airgap your machine.  As in, disconnect it from the internet.  Turning off the wifi or unplugging the cable would suffice.   This is just a safety measure as I'm going to ask you to turn off your anti-virus apps.  

Run KSP.   Run it a few times.  

If it works a few times, turn your AV back on.   See if it still works a few times.  

Now reconnect to the internet as desired.

Test again.

If it crashes, just remember what you turned on right before it crashed, and then we can look into that.
